intro: Cyanea solenocalyx f. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-flowered Cyanea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant has smooth, glabrous leaves and thrives in coastal and mesic habitats. It plays a significant role in the local ecosystem, providing nectar for native pollinators. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
